Problem:
Consider a system governed by the complex function \\( z(t) = e^{i \omega t} \\), where \\( \omega \\) is a constant real number representing angular frequency. We examine changes when applying a transformation \\( g(z) = kz \\) where \\( k \\) is a complex constant, modifying the amplitude and phase.

Given the state of the system at time T as \\( z(T) = k e^{i \omega T} \\), can we conclude that the transformation \\( g(z) = kz \\) was indeed applied at t = 0?
Explanation: From \\( z(T) \\) alone, without prior knowledge of the initial condition or the transformation \\( g(z) \\), multiple causative factors could lead to the same observed state, such as different values of \\( k \\) or even other types of transformations not considered here.
